Instruction: Combine warm water, yeast, and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes.
Combine yeast mixture in a large bowl with oil, salt, and 2 1/2 cups of flour. Gradually knead in the remaining flour until the dough is smooth and no longer sticky. Transfer dough to an oiled bowl.
Let the dough rise until it doubles in size, for approximately 1 hour, covered with a clean towel.
Shape the dough into a loaf. Allow the dough to rest for a few minutes before baking.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
Prepare the toppings and sauce while the dough is resting.
